qas.question: What is a benefit of using dBASE?

plausible_answers.text: lightweight and easy for any computer user to understand out of the box
data manipulation is done by dBASE

qas.question: What is the only benefit of using dBASE?
When was BASE the top selling software title?

context: The 1980s ushered in the age of desktop computing. The new computers empowered their users with spreadsheets like Lotus 1-2-3 and database software like dBASE. The dBASE product was <a1_0><b5_0>lightweight and easy for any computer user to understand out of the box<b5_0/><a1_0/>. <a0_0><b4_0>C. Wayne Ratliff<b4_0/><a0_0/> the creator of dBASE stated: "dBASE was different from programs like BASIC, C, FORTRAN, and COBOL in that a lot of the dirty work had already been done. The <a2_0><b6_0>data manipulation is done by dBASE<b6_0/><a2_0/> instead of by the user, so the user can concentrate on what he is doing, rather than having to mess with the dirty details of opening, reading, and closing files, and <a3_0><b7_0>managing space allocation<b7_0/><a3_0/>." dBASE was one of the top selling software titles in the <b8_0>1980s and early 1990s<b8_0/>.
